summary: Halloween is a fun holiday celebrated on October 31st, the night before All Saints' Day. It has roots in ancient Celtic festivals like Samhain and was brought to North America by Irish and Scottish immigrants. Kids love to dress up and go trick-or-treating, asking for candy. People also carve pumpkins, play pranks, and tell scary stories. It's a time to enjoy spooky fun and learn about different cultures and traditions. Some people also attend church services to remember the dead.
title: Halloween
